One Class at a Time Award

span.font: On Thursday April 9th, Governor Parson ordered all Missouri Public Schools to remain closed through the remainder of the school year. Hannibal Public Schools will remain closed through May 22nd. At this time, no decision has been made on summer school and we will wait for guidance from Governor Parson and the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education to make that decision.

font.span: e have been providing 3 meals daily to approximately 1,600 kids each day. We are happy to provide this service during this difficult time, however, we are needing to change our delivery model, locations, and time to ensure the safety of our students and staff beginning this Thursday, April 9th. Any child 18 and under is eligible for free meals.

p.span: Beginning on Monday, April 20th, our food distribution program times will change. All food provided to children ages 18 and under will be distributed from 10 to 11:30 Monday through Friday at the 5 elementary schools and Hannibal Middle School. We hope this service is helping your family during this difficult time. We miss our students and want to urge everyone to stay at home when possible, social distance from others, wash hands regularly and stay well.

span.font: If you are driving to one of the above sites, please remain in your car and someone will deliver food to you. If you are walking to a site, please remember to keep at least 6 feet between yourself and others. We want to ensure that meals are provided in an orderly and safe manner so I appreciate your patience and willingness to maintain social distancing.
This information will be available on our district website and our district Facebook page.

span.span: BOARD OF EDUCATION RE-ORGANIZATION MEETING - APRIL 15, 2020:

span.font: PHASE 2 LEARNING INFO, BEGINNING 04/14/2020: CLICK HERE

font.span: In order to help during this difficult time, the technology department will be accepting calls to help people connect the Chromebooks that have been passed out.
The Hannibal Technology Department will have someone at the help desk starting Monday April 20 through May 22nd from 11 am till 3 pm. Please call 231-0055.
anticipate a large volume of calls,
f you have to leave a voicemail, please leave your name, a time you are available and a number we can reach you at.
We will respond to voicemails in the order they are received.

br.span: Posted Feb 25, 2019, 10:35 AM by HPS Webmasters

p.span: It is with great enthusiasm that I welcome you back for another incredible school year! There are lots of outstanding things happening at our schools so be sure to check out our school social media sites, keep an eye on your mail and email, and watch for flyers and other materials that will be sent home with your students the first few days of school to let you know about many of these exciting planned events!
ou can also check out the Hannibal School District on social media.
This has been a busy summer and a lot of construction projects have been completed, others are currently underwa
and more will continue to take place through the end of next summer. Some of those completed projects are listed below:

font.span: New Heating Ventilation Air-Conditioning installed at Hannibal High School and Hannibal Career and Technical Center
All new plumbing installed at Hannibal High School
Drop ceilings installed throughout Hannibal High School and in corridors at Hannibal Career & Technical Center
Fire alarm systems on main campus connected to Fire department to enhance safety
LED lighting installed throughout the district
Control systems installed throughout the school district
Overhead electrical systems have been removed and buried to enhance safety at Porter Stadium
New water fountains installed at Hannibal High School, many with water bottle filler systems

Installation of temporary air-conditioning window units in an additional 11 Hannibal Middle School classrooms so HMS can plan for cooler conditions this school year while their new HVAC is installed next summer

p.span: More construction projects will continue this fall, including the installation of new double-pane windows on the main campus. We are proud to share these facility improvements with your students and are excited to see what how these improvements will enhance the student achievement at the beginning of this new school year.

As a parent you can help us to ensure the educational success of your children by stressing to your children that attendance in school is important. Did you know that absenteeism in the first month of school can predict poor attendance throughout the school year? Did you know that poor attendance can influence whether children read proficiently by the end of third grade? Did you know that by 6th grade, chronic absence becomes a leading indicator that a student will drop out of high school? Finally, did you know that research shows missing 10% of the school year (or about 18 days) actually has a negative impact on a student's academic performance? That is just tw

In closing, the Hannibal School District's staff continue to work tirelessly to make our schools a place where you child wants to come each and every day to challenge themselves, to socialize, and to achieve all that they can achieve as learners! We ALL CARE DEEPLY about the safety and success of our children! We are lucky to have

- building positive relationships with each and every student! I look forward to another great year! Please do not hesitate to reach out to me with any questions, comments, or concerns you may have throughout the year. My email is sjohnson@hannibal60.com and my office phone number is 221-1258. See you all soon! GO PIRATES!

div.span: The Hannibal School District will provide access to virtual (online) coursework for students. Students and families that are interested in virtual coursework should contact their student’s school counselor and inquire about our virtual program options and the Missouri Course Access Program (MOCAP).
